Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: .5 (one hour once a month plus an hour to read related literature)
I think we needed more basics first, I knew nothing about modelling coming in.
This is a great seminar-- looking forward to it again next semester!

It was a really great seminar that brought it a lot of interesting professors from across disciplines who use modeling in their research. I thought it helped give people a better idea of what kind of work people could do using modeling and how modeling is used in the real world. I think I would just like some more background given per presenter because for some of them, I didn't really understand the work they were doing because there was background information about the models or the research itself that I didn't know so maybe sending out some information prior to the seminar about what the presenter presents on would be nice.
I liked this course but sometimes the material was so far over my head. Ive never done modeling before, and as someone new I had no idea what was happening most of the time.

Awesome seminar! Most of the presentations were very interesting and inspiring; we were exposed to a good range of modeling techniques. Some of them were relevant to my current modeling class, so it was cool to see how the material I was learning was applied in the real world.

Sometimes the seminar times were changed so I could not make to some of them.
Also, it was not clear about what the course instructor was expecting from the students.

Strengths:
-great to see how public health modeling applies to a variety of topics

Strengths: Very interesting content and engaging conversations
Weaknesses: Logistical--not enough food, room was too small

Great insight into work being done using modeling techniques and different career paths that use modeling in public health. Really enjoyed the journal club as well to help with complicated topics before the seminar.
Great monthly seminar series on modeling.
Loved him as a professor in cost-effective! The nature of this seminar didn't really allow him to show his teaching skills.
Professor Paltiel assembles a thoughtful seminar that gives us good exposure to various topics in modeling.

One of the best professors at Yale! He created such a positive vibe for everyone and seemed willing to offer students guidance/advice on the modeling concentration or how to connect with the speakers.
The instructor is dedicated to the course and provides interesting topics.
Great job selecting engaging speakers who use modeling in different ways. No substantive feedback.
Fantastic: always has a great introduction, excellent questions, and encourages others to participate.
Yes! I think that if anyone is interested in what modeling is about, this is a great start to introducing the topic.
Would recommend because interesting to see whats happening in the field but its not a good introduction to modeling because the presentations are expert-level modeling

Great seminar if you'd like to get some exposure to modeling and people working in the field! I would recommend this seminar to anyone from all departments who are interested in applying modeling techniques in their work.
The course is great to learn more about the applications of modeling.
I would recommend it because it can help you learn the application of modeling concepts in public health area.
If you are at all interested in policy modeling you should take this class.
Highly recommend for anyone interested in learning more about modeling!
